quote: I am merely a businessman.  It would    take an orator with the skills of    the late, great Plegg himself, to    sing the praises of the late, great    Plegg.

What Ferengi could resist the honor    of owning a small piece of the man    who took a computer chip and turned    it into the modular holosuite    industry... a small piece of the man    who brought holographic entertainment    to the most remote parts of this    quadrant, creating profit centers    from societies that could barely    afford to feed their own people...
How much are you asking?
As I was about to tell my good friend    here, a mere three strips of    latinum...
And I'd be taking a loss at that    price... okay, for you, two strips...    (sighs, he's lost     him, to odo)   Thank you very much.
Three strips?  That's a fair price    for Plegg.
I suppose you're interested.
Humanoid death rituals are an interest    of mine.
Death rituals.
Everybody needs a hobby.
Uh huh...

Some species burn their dead, others    pack them in blocks of ice... some    even surround themselves with the    company of family corpses.  But the    Ferengi ritual of chopping up their    loved ones and selling them... I    find that... irresistible.
I'm very busy here.
What a fitting and dignified way to    honor the memory of great Ferengi    entrepreneurs.  I'm thinking of    starting a collection.
Putting up a display case in my    office.  There'll be a special space    reserved for you in there, Quark.
I'm sure.
You're serious?
Have you ever known me not to be?
Oh, there is one thing I was curious    about...
(knows something's     coming)   And what's that...
How do I know it's Plegg?
It says so on the label.
Isn't there some sort of letter of    authenticity?
The Ferengi Seal of Dismemberment is    right there.  What more do you want?
I want Plegg.
You've got him!
Not if he's still alive...
Still alive?
Still alive.
Plegg?
When I tracked him down on Khosla    Two and told him about your little    scheme, he was quite amused.  I'm    not.
Odo, I'm a victim here.  I bought    these discs in good faith.  I have    five thousand pieces of Plegg in my    storeroom.
Not Plegg.
Then who?
Good question.
I demand an investigation...
You'll get one.  I promise you.
Odo...
Doctor Mora...
It's been too long.
You're looking well.  Yes, coming    along nicely.
Why didn't you let me know you were    coming?
It was a last minute arrangement.
The trip from Bajor takes five hours.
Ah, can I get you something... Doctor    "Mora" was it?
Yes.  Some Deka tea would be nice...
You haven't quite managed the ears,    yet, have you?  But, they're    difficult.  Is the suit a suit, or    part of you?  And what about the    boots?
There we are... nice and hot...
Thank you...
So...       You two seem to be old friends...
Doctor Mora is the Bajoran scientist    who was assigned to me after I was    found.
I was personally responsible for his    development during his formative    years.
Then, this is a family reunion!  I    had a hunch... well, Odo's dad is    always welcome in Quark's... the tea    is on the house...
I know he wouldn't tell you himself.     But Odo is doing a wonderful job    here on the station if I may say    so...
Is he...
Absolutely.  As a matter of fact,    when you came in, he was just    beginning a fraud investiga...
Quark!       Excuse us.
Of course.  You two have a lot of    catching up to do.  If there's    anything I can help you with, Doctor,    don't hesitate to call on me.
That was uncalled for.
You don't know Quark.
I know he was trying very hard to    present you in a positive light to    someone he thought was important to    you and you responded with...
("don't lecture me"     implied)   Please...
Still having trouble with social    integration... ?
I integrate as much as I want to.
Define "as much as I want to."
"As much as I want to" means as much    as I want to.    (already tired of     this, a last defense)
So how is this police thing you got    yourself into working out?
I enjoy my work as chief of security.
(casual, not realizing     the pain this causes)   "Chief of security."  At a weigh    station in space.
Don't you miss it, Odo?
What.
Our work.
Never.

I don't believe it.  I know you too    well.  You were unhappy in the lab.     I couldn't blame you for that.  But    the work, Odo.  The exploration of    you.  What you are.  Where you came    from.  That's never far from your    mind, is it.  Tell me the truth.
That part of it... is true.
Good.  Because I came here counting    on that.
See you later, Dad...
Hey... hey... hold on...
I'm late...
For what?
For Nog.
Your homework...
It's done...
You've studied that whole Klingon    opera for your music test Friday?...
I'm gonna ace the test, Dad, I    promise...
That isn't what I asked...
It's not until Friday...
This isn't about tests, Jake.  This    is about learning.
You can't learn to appreciate Klingon    opera by just cramming the night    before an exam.
I'm never gonna learn to appreciate    Klingon opera.  It's a waste of time.
Being with Nog is not a waste of    time but Klingon opera is?
Yeah!       What am I ever going to use Klingon    opera for?
First of all, you don't know what    you'll be when you grow up... you    may discover along the way you want    to be a musician or you may wind up    around Klingons in some job    somewhere...
Dad, even if I do, they won't be    going around singing operas...
It helps to understand their    culture...
When was the last time you listened    to a Klingon opera?
(beat, knowing that     he's getting sucked     in)   When I was your age.
There, you see?
Yes.  Do you?
Dad, just because you had to suffer    through all that doesn't mean I have    to.
Yes.  It does.
Come in...
Dad...
Nog has the same test.  Why don't    you invite him over to listen to the    Klingon opera together?
Sit down, Odo.
Commander, I'd like to request the    use of a runabout.
Of course.  What's up?
Doctor Mora Pol from the Bajoran    Institute of Science asked me to    help him secure one from the    Federation.
Why did he come to you?

Doctor Mora was the scientist who    was assigned to me in my first years    here... if he went to the Board of    Ministers to request permission to    approach you, it would take months.     And he's very anxious to investigate    something in the Gamma Quadrant.     And may I say, Commander, so am I.
You've got me curious, Constable.     Is it a secret?

No, but there isn't much to tell.     One of the Bajoran science probes    recently scanned a planet about six    light years from the wormhole.  It    picked up some very unique and    familiar DNA patterns.  Patterns    very much like my own, Commander.       Doctor Mora thinks he may have found    the origin of my people... of...    me...

As a scientist yourself, Lieutenant,    you can appreciate the difficulty of    our dilemma, and the elegance of the    solution.  When Odo was first found,    no one knew who, or indeed, what we    were dealing with.
A shapeless, viscous mass of fluid,    a veritable organic broth.  That was    our Odo in the beginning.
When did you realize you were dealing    with a sentient lifeform?
He didn't.  I had to teach him that    myself.
That's true.  That's very true.     Tell her.
It was a dilemma for me.  I'd never    seen anything like these creatures    either.
"Seen" isn't really an appropriate    description.  He had no eyes per    se...
I was only trying to describe it in    simple terms...
He had never perceived anything like    us before... go on...
And I knew I had to find some way to    communicate with them.  So I    transformed myself into...

(taking the story     away)   It was remarkable.  I'd been coming    into the lab every morning, and every    morning Odo was still in his liquid    form, resting in a Krokan petri    beaker.  Well... one morning, Odo    wasn't there.  The beaker was empty,    and beside it: an identical beaker    that had not been there before.
A perfect replica in every way.  It    was amazing.       It hasn't been the same since you    left, Odo.  Working with you was the    most rewarding part of my career.
We're approaching the planet.
Preparing to enter standard orbit...    planet designated L-S-Six.
Initiating scans.
There's a lot of seismic activity    down there... possibly volcanic in    origin...
That's consistent with the probe's    analysis of the area...
Perhaps that's why the changelings    had to leave this world...
"Changelings?"  That's a new one.
I've met people from the Gamma    quadrant who've heard stories of a    lifeform...
(laughs, interrupting,     victorious)   And you said you weren't interested    in our work anymore...
That's not what I said...
I think I've located the area where    the probe identified the trace    elements... I'm picking up the same    DNA traces... entering coordinates...
Moving into synchronous orbit.
Look at these readings, Doctor... I    believe there's some kind of    artificial structure on the surface...
(smiles, in     anticipation)   Is it safe to go down, Lieutenant?
Surface disturbances are minor...    for the moment anyway...
Let's do it.
Do the letters mean anything to you?
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: No.  I don't think so.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Well, judging by its position in the    ruins, I think it's fair to say this    pillar represented something important    to the people who lived here.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Why don't we take it with us... our    computer back on the station might    be able to decipher the inscription...
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Where's Doctor Weld gone to?     Weld?
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Over here.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: I may have found what we're looking    for.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Is it carbon based?
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: No.  Silicate, but vegetative, and    very much alive.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Odo Junior, perhaps?
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Computer, begin transport.
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Computer, realign transporter...    lock on to our combadges...
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Stand by...
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Ready for transport...
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Computer, energize!
scene: 8    EXT. PLANET SURFACE - AMID THE RUINS (OPTICAL)

quote: Deep Space Nine... this is the Rio    Grande.  I have seriously injured    personnel on board.  Request emergency    action.
(on communicator to     Odo)   We read you, Odo.  Who's injured?
Dax, Doctor Mora, and Doctor Weld.     There was some kind of volcanic gas...
When you get within transporter range,    I'll beam them directly to the    Infirmary.
Alert Doctor Bashir.

They're stable for now.  Dax is in    fair condition, the Bajorans seem to    be more seriously affected.  Perhaps    they were exposed to more of the    gas, or there may be something about    Trill physiology... I'm not sure    yet...
And Odo?
I'm fine.
The paralyzing action occurred when    the gas was taken into the respiratory    system.  Since Odo doesn't have a    respiratory system as we know it, he    apparently wasn't affected at all.

O'Brien's off-loaded the cargo they    brought back.  He's set up everything    in the Science Lab.  I understand    there are some organic specimens    from that planet.  Maybe there's    something that can help you figure    this out.
Good idea.
Will he be all right?
The molecule appears to have quite    an unstable structure.  That might    mean the effect is temporary.
I know how you feel, Constable.
Feel?  About what?

When my father got ill... I remember    thinking how small and weak he looked    lying there in the bed.  He'd been    so strong... independent... to me it    always seemed there was nothing he    couldn't do.  In the end, I realized    that there was nothing he could do.     And nothing I could do to help him.
I appreciate your thoughts, Commander.     But Doctor Mora is not my father.
Kak-lah... Kak-lah... Kah-pool-AYYY-   do-la-kak-lah... Yoh boo la to dah...    Yoh boo la to da...
The computer's having a hard time    classifying your new lifeform.
Why?
Whatever it is keeps changing...    somehow it goes through a    metamorphosis every time it    reproduces... and it reproduces like    crazy.  Look at this...
It's multiplied so much, I had to    change containers... I'll put it in    a level-five security field overnight.     I wish Dax were here to take a look    at it... how's she doing... ?
Doctor Bashir thinks she'll be fine...
Have any idea what it is?
I'm hoping it's a key, Mister O'Brien.     A key to my past.
Kira to Sisko.
Go ahead, Major...
Sorry to bother you, Commander.  But    we need you up here in the Science    Lab.
I'm on my way.
Any signs of a break-in?
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Not that we've been able to find...    the security seal on the lab was    still in place when we got here...
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: I can't imagine why anyone would    want to steal that thing anyway...
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: You're suggesting the lifeform itself    did this...
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: I don't know what did this.     Commander.  Unless a tornado passed    this way without us hearing it.  The    room was locked.  It's gone... that's    all I know for now.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Let's go to yellow alert.  Get a    Level Three Security Scan of the    entire station underway.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Our scanners are probably gonna have    trouble finding this lifeform.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: It has metamorphic qualities that    were confusing the computer.  You    better run the sweep two or three    times.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Major, you could help me by reviewing    the security camera records and the    heat sensor readouts for the Lab and    the surrounding areas.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Commander, I'm picking up slight    trace elements near the ventilation    intake duct.  It looks as though    the lifeform may have taken this way    out.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Doctor Bashir give you permission to    be up and about?
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: (as she moves,     examining the damage)   "Doctor Bashir" wouldn't listen to    me and hid my clothes so I wouldn't    leave.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: I had to sneak out to my quarters in    a hospital gown that wouldn't close    in the back... but I met a nice ensign    on the way.  What did this...
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: The working theory is that the    lifeform you brought back is somehow    responsible...
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: I don't believe it.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Good.  Find me a better theory.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: Odo, Doctor Mora is awake and wants    to see you.
scene: 33   INT. SCIENCE LAB - MOMENTS AFTER PREVIOUS SCENE

quote: I heard them say something had    happened in the lab.
The lifeform sample is gone.
Gone?
We're not sure why or how yet...
I want to help...
Everything is under control...
I know more about shape-shifters than    anyone in this sector...
Anyone except me, and I'll be running    the investigation.
Besides we're not even sure it is a    shape-shifting lifeform...
Any metamorphic characteristics?
It was changing faster than the    computer could analyze.
Any indication of intelligence...
Not unless you consider wanton    destruction of the lab an indication    of intelligence...
It might be... It might be... Don't    dismiss any possibility...
Doctor Weld hasn't regained    consciousness.  I feel... responsible.
I know Doctor Bashir is doing    everything possible.
The same trace elements are inside    the duct...
I'm following the trail, moving toward    Corridor Two-H...
Nothing's showing up anywhere on the    scanners, Chief.
Yeah, I figured as much.  Did the    security cameras in the lab give you    anything?
The security cameras stopped operating    for forty-three seconds at zero-three    hundred hours, five minutes... right    when the alarm sounded...
Stopped... you mean somebody turned    them off?
More likely some kind of power    interruption... It might have affected    the security field around the lifeform    too... We're trying to analyze it    now...
Do the heat sensors in the lab show    any thermal deviation at the same    time?
Almost a six degree increase during    the forty-three seconds...
But then back to normal after that.
Affirmative.
We might be dealing with an entity    that absorbs low frequency R-F    energy... it might be feeding off    our power...
But an energy drain should be showing    up on our scans...
Yeah, that's true, Constable.  I    don't get it.  Maybe this thermal    deviation was the result of...
Chief?
Hold on, I hear something.
We've got your position.  Nothing    else is showing up anywhere near    you...
Well, I definitely hear something    ahead... can you hear it on the comm    line... ?
No...
It almost sounds like... I don't    know how to describe it... I'm moving    in closer...       If you run into my wife, don't mention    I did this...
Move some backup to the nearest    corridor...
(acknowledges, hits     combadge)   Security to Core Section, Level Four,    Corridor Two-H...
I'll come home tonight and she'll    ask me how my day was... and I'll    say, fine, honey, how was yours?...
Sometimes I think she really doesn't    want to know the truth, so I do us    both a favor and...
Just a structural breach... we need    to get a maintenance crew up here...
Shouldn't be any problem to...
Ahhh!
O'Brien report!
I'm okay... I'm fine... I found our    missing lifeform...
Except it's not a lifeform anymore.     It's dead.

Station log, Stardate 47391.7.     Engineering crews have been working    for over fifteen hours searching    conduits throughout the core section.     There have been no additional    incidents and no further evidence of    the alien lifeform has been found.     Yellow alert has been canceled.
With this kind of cellular structure,    the lifeform would have needed a    higher concentration of carbon dioxide    than our atmosphere provides...
It just couldn't survive out of its    own environment.
That'd be my analysis...
But with that in mind, do you still    think this lifeform was capable of    destroying the lab?
It's not impossible.  The    environmental impact might have taken    some time to set in.
I really would like Doctor Mora's    opinion on all this...
He's a lot better.  He should be up    and around in the morning.
Feel like a Raktajino before we call    it a night?
My replicator or yours...
I was thinking of the Promenade.
I knew that.  Thanks anyway.  I have    a few things to wrap up here.
Sleep tight, Julian.
She enjoys it... it gives her some    perverse kind of pleasure.  One of    these days, I'll stop chasing her    and then we'll see...
as he wonders to himself what the    noise might have been, we see a vague    figure drop silently from the ceiling    behind him... Bashir doesn't react...
Emergency!  Emergency!  Intruder    alert.
It happened so quickly.  I'm sorry I    can't tell you more about it.  It    was behind me, then it was gone.     But it was big.  Very big.
How badly did you injure it?

I don't know.  I don't know if I    injured it at all.  I just hit it    once with a laser scalpel on its    arm, or leg, or tentacle... whatever    it was, and it moved up the wall    and... was gone.
(with scientific     distance)   It appears our lifeform has survived    and grown into something interesting.

Did you notice anything else about    the room when you entered, Doctor...    anything out of place, anything    unusual...    (Bashir shakes his     head, doesn't think     so)   Was it unusually warm, perhaps?
Now that you mention it, it was a    bit warm in here...
Another thermal distortion... Did    you try the lights, Doctor?
No, I didn't want to disturb the    patients.
Commander, I suggest we check the R-   F energy flow to the Infirmary... we    might find a power interruption just    as we did in the lab.
No blood, or any fluid traces.  But    I am picking up a very slight trail    of something we didn't see last time.     An organic residue.
Enough to test?
We'll see.
Sisko to Ops.KIRA'S COM VOICE Go    ahead.
Restrict all nonessential personnel    to their quarters and go to red alert,    Major.
Understood.
Keep in touch with Dax's progress...    she might give us a way to track    this thing...
Until we can, I suggest we close    down the Promenade.
I'll give the order, Constable.
"Constable."
It's a nickname that I barely    tolerate.
It's the expression of affection    that you find uncomfortable.
You know, that was really a remarkable    display back there...
Display?
You were careful, attentive...
I was just doing my job.
Yes, well, I'm beginning to think    that the scientific method and the    police method have a lot in common.
I never thought of it that way.     Perhaps they do.

In science we look for the obvious.     We track in straight lines.  If    something looks too good to be true,    it probably isn't true.  If there    seems to be more to something than    meets the eye, there usually is    more.  We take it step by step.
That would apply to criminal    investigation also.
You do it very well.       I'm proud of you, Odo.  Did you know    that?
Anything?
The computer's having trouble breaking    down the DNA chains.
What about the pillar... has the    computer had any success decoding    the encryption?
No luck there either.  All things    considered, the computer's having a    bad week.  We have such a limited    database for the Gamma Quadrant...
I have to shut down the Promenade...    call me when you have something...
Wasn't that pillar over there before?
(without looking up     from her work)   I had to have it moved.  It was in    my way.
Have you compared this new organic    sample to the lifeform we brought    back from the planet... ?
Only enough to be sure that it's not    the same...
It might be interesting to see if    there are any commonalties at all.
Let me run a cross-tabulation    analysis... it should only take a    couple of minutes...
Do you know Odo well, Lieutenant?
Not as well as I'd like to.  He...    keeps to himself a lot.
I'm not surprised.       I didn't realize... until I actually    saw him...       ... how much I missed him... we didn't    part on very good terms...
So I've heard.

I didn't want him to leave.  We still    had so much work to do...    (not entirely convinced     of what he's saying)   But I see him now and I wonder if he    wasn't right to go after all... he's    come such a long way...
He's an invaluable man around here.

I never thought he could do it.     Integrate successfully.  If you could    have seen him back then, how ill-   prepared he was to be on his own...       I was so sure he'd come back.  When    he left, I told him he'd come back...    And all these years, I was still    certain that eventually, he'd show    up one day at the lab...       I guess I'd better get used to the    idea that he's not going to.
Here we are...
Which one is this?
That's the new one from the Infirmary.       This is the lifeform from the    planet... but remember it went through    several metamorphoses...
No, it's not the same entity... the    nucleotide sequences are entirely    different...
Some metachromic similarities...
Yes... on the most basic level... it    may be a distant cousin at best...
The computer's broken down the DNA    chain on the new sample.
I can run an analysis to see if it    matches up with any other lifeform    in the computer...
How long will that take?
Two, three hours, maybe.
Let me know.
Doctor Weld has regained    consciousness.  It looks like he'll    be fine.
That's a relief.
You don't seem relieved.
(appreciating him     anew)   You can tell that just by observing    me, can't you... the tone of my voice,    my eyes, my body movements...
Yes.
You are such a remarkable lifeform,    Odo.  But there is so much we still    don't understand about you.
What are you getting at, Doctor... ?

The computer has broken down the    DNA chain of the organic sample we    found in the Infirmary.  Dax is    running an analysis of it now.  She'll    have it identified in a couple of    hours.  But I already know what it    is.  I've seen it before.  The organic    sample... it's from you, Odo.

The destruction in the Science Lab    occurred at zero-three hundred hours,    five minutes.  Then the attack in    the Infirmary occurred at nineteen-   thirty-five.  Roughly sixteen hours    apart.  Is your rejuvenation period    still sixteen hours...
I was in my pail during both attacks.
But were you... I don't think so.     I think, Odo, that you have been in    the rather ironic position of trying    to track down... yourself.
How could this be?
Has anything like this happened    before?
Of course not.
Are you certain?
Of course, I'm certain.  There would    have been incidents.
No unsolved crimes on the books?
There are always unsolved crimes.
Then, the possibility exists...
It doesn't.  I do not commit    criminal acts.  It is not in my    nature.
(the evidence before     us)   Isn't it?
The gas.  Maybe it was the gas on    the planet.  It must have affected    me in some way.
A possibility.
That has to be it.
It's certainly worth investigating.
Doctor Bashir might be able to...

Doctor Bashir won't be able to    understand anything about this...    except that you turned into some    kind of out-of-control thing that    almost killed him.  Really, Odo.     What do you think they'll do with    you?
Do?
They won't know what to do.  They'll    put you in some kind of high security    prison, or quarantine you on a    deserted asteroid in the Gamma    Quadrant.  Odo, they'll put you in a    zoo.
I don't believe that.  You don't    know them...
What other humanoid have you ever    been able to trust except me?
What makes you think I trust you...

I resent that.  I really do.  After    the time I invested in you.  The    education I gave you.  The attention    I gave you.  You wouldn't be here    today without my guidance.  I gave    you more than anyone else in my life.     You were my life.  And you walked    away.  Now, you don't trust me?     Fine, put yourself in their hands    then.  Always had to learn your    lessons the hard way, didn't you...
I am not going back to the center    with you...
Why?  We'll work through this    together.  The two of us.
We'll solve it together.  Just as we    used to.
No.
Commander, I've got a power failure    in Security...
Sisko to Odo...       Sisko to Odo.
All deputies report to Security    Office... possible intruder.
I'm tracking it...

We have a power drain in the life    support conduit above the Security    Office.  If it's feeding off our    power, we might be able to slow it    down by shutting off the primary    flow to the entire core section...
Do it.
Where the hell did it come from?
And where's Odo...
Go ahead.
No sign of Odo?
Nossir.
I can help you with that, Major.
The creature you're after is Odo.       There must have been... some kind of    metamorphic reaction to the volcanic    gas we encountered on the planet.
Is there any way to communicate with    him?
I don't know.  It's not Odo really...    it's separate and independent from    the Odo we know... and yet...       At the very least, it is aware... of    me.
How can you know that?

The incident in the Science Lab... I    think it was an attempt to "rescue"    the lifeform I put into containment...    the second encounter was in the    Infirmary where I was sleeping...    the third took place minutes ago    when we were having a... heated    discussion in Security.  I think    your... "Constable" himself would    draw the same conclusion from the    evidence... on some instinctual level,    this creature is familiar with me.
He might even conclude it has hostile    intentions toward you.
That has occurred to me.
The power shutdown is complete,    Commander.  Odo... or whatever it    is... has stopped moving for the    moment.
Chief, based on your knowledge of    its behavior, if we can lure him    out, is there any way to set up a    forcefield that can hold him...
We could reverse polarity on the    energy fields and it might work...    but that's only a guess.
Set it up on the Promenade... I want    a lot of room to operate... Major,    station security teams along the    perimeter...
How do we get him to come out of the    conduits?
Maybe we can use some R-F energy    bursts to attract him...
I think there's only one thing that's    going to attract that creature into    your trap.  It's me he's after.
Mister O'Brien?
Our plan seems to be working,    Commander.  It's following my trail    of energy crumbs right toward you...
On my signal, open the conduit and    let him in...
Aye, sir...

We can't be sure which vent he'll    come through.  Hopefully, it'll be    the first one available to him...       ... over there... but if not, there    are seventeen others he might choose.     We're not stationing officers near    any of them... we don't want to scare    him away.
I understand.
Just get him to the forcefield.     We'll do the rest.

Pass the word that phasers are to be    set on maximum stun... the moment    Doctor Mora appears to be in jeopardy,    I'll open fire.  Their orders are to    follow my lead.  If maximum stun    doesn't bring him down immediately,    we set phasers to kill.
Commander...
I know, Major.  Those are the orders.
Mister O'Brien, we're ready.
Releasing the conduit seal.
Doctor Mora, did you hear that?
Ready and waiting.
What are you waiting for?  I'm here.     And I'm not going anywhere.
I've done it to you again, haven't    I, Odo.  Made you a prisoner.  Dear    God, what have I done.
Mister O'Brien, drop the field.
Aye, sir.
We have a lot to talk about.

I'm not going to try to explain    exactly what happened to you, Odo...    because I haven't the vaguest idea...    I can tell you with Doctor Mora's    help we've managed to eliminate all    traces of the gas from your cellular    structure... I'll prescribe rest    because it's hard for a doctor to go    wrong with that one... but otherwise,    there's not much more I can do for    you.
Thank you, Doctor.
I'm going home.
Doctor Mora, I want to be sure you    know that I had no idea...
You had to speak in a voice loud    enough for me to hear.
I'm... sorry.

I'm sorry it was necessary.       I would like... in a small way... to    be a part of your life again... your    life on the station.  From time to    time, we could talk.  About things    that matter to you.  To us.
I'd... like that.
